result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick Lorenzo McCree Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 11/19/2015. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court will allow the defendant to enter into a payment plan.
Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge;
FORTHWITH; Defendant may have work release and may participate in vocational training at the House of Correction; credit for 3 days time served.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick Lorenzo McCree Jr

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Derrick Lorenzo McCree Jr
Current: 501 W. Clybourne Apt. #1, Milwaukee, WI 53208 United States  (Effective: 05-19-2015)
Prior: 9139 G  N. 75th St., Milwaukee, WI 53223

Defendant Derrick Lorenzo McCree in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State placed negotiations on the record. 
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.
Court advised the defendant of the sex offender registry requirements.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Derrick Lorenzo McCree in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Defense counsel requests an adjournment. State does not object. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not in court when next court date was selected. Case heard off the record. Defense has received discovery and requests a Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Defendant appeared later in the morning and was given next court date in person. Parties notified of defendant's appearance in court. Case adjourned to branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Derrick Lorenzo McCree in court. Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Scheduling Conference. Case heard off the record. Attorney Taylor is in Branch 22 with lengthly hearings and unable to appear this morning.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to allow Attorney Taylor to appear. Defense given new date in person. Defense counsel notified via phone of next court date. Case adjourned to branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Derrick Lorenzo McCree in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Ron Dague for Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on the Defendant's behalf. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed. Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 03/02/2015.
HMP

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Derrick Lorenzo McCree in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Derrick Lorenzo McCree in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
